alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:09AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Cherry, eastern Hooker, northwestern Logan, northeastern McPherson, northwestern Blaine and Thomas Counties through 345 AM CDT/245 AM MDT/... At 309 AM CDT/209 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of Brownlee to 13 miles south of Mullen. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thedford, Halsey, Seneca, Purdum, Highway 83 crossing The Dismal River, Norway, Highway 97 crossing the Dismal River, Hawley Flats, Natwick, Kelso and Shimmons Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 187 and 230. Highway 97 between mile markers 40 and 65. Highway 83 between mile markers 127 and 164. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry
